answer.explanation:
M: Sorry that I couldn’t go to lunch today with you, Beth. When I got to the office this morning, there was an e-mail from my supervisor about a special staff meeting at 11:30. WB: That’s OK, Jack. Q1 I just went and got a sandwich from the cafeteria and ate it in the park. So … what was the meeting about?
M: Well, they Q2 announced a contract with Yoon Corporation to develop a new software program. But, because of the deadline, we’ll probably have to work a lot of overtime to finish up the work by January first.
W: Q3 You should be happy to get the contract. Lots of companies around here have had to lay off employees recently because they don’t have enough work for them to do.

question.text: How did Beth spend her lunch hour?
choices: (A)She had a meeting with a customer.
(C) She visited her friend at Yoon Corporation.
(D) She ate a sandwich in the park.

answer.text: (D) She ate a sandwich in the park.

question.text: What are the speakers mainly talking about?

M: Q1&2 Could I get some information about the interest rates on student loans?
W: The rates depend on your income and the amount of the loan. This brochure explains how to fill out the application forms.
M: I see. And if I send in my application today, how long will it take to be processed? I need to make sure I have money to pay for my classes next month.
W: Q3 It usually takes about four days. The business office can call you as soon as the loan has been approved.

answer.explanation:
M: Hello. Jeffrey Hines speaking.
W: This is Martha Benjamin. I’m calling to Q1 let you know I’ve put my research report in the interoffice mail. You should have it this afternoon. I hope you’re still willing to review it for me.
M: Of course. I’ll be out of town on business for the next few days, but I’ll take it with me. I also have your request for additional money to Q2 continue your research.
W: Thanks very much. Don’t worry about the typos - I’ll be sending the report to an editor. But please make suggestions about the content. Q3 It’s only the first draft and I’m going to make revisions. I’m really looking forward to your feedback.

question.text: What is the purpose of Martha’s call to Jeffrey?
choices: (A)To tell him she is going out of town
(B)To ask him to pay for some additional research
(C)To thank him for meeting with her
(D)To tell him she mailed a report to him

answer.text: (D)To tell him she mailed a report to him

answer.explanation:
W-Am: Excuse me, I've been coming to this fitness center for a while now, but Q1 I'll be transferring to my company's office in London for several months, so I'm going to have to cancel my membership.
M-Au: Did you know Q2 you can suspend your membership for up to six months? If you do that, you won't have to pay any new member activation fees when you return.
W-Am: Oh, that's fabulous - I do like the exercise classes here, and I was planning to enroll again when I get back from London.
M-Au: Q3 All we'll need is a letter from your company stating how long you'll be away on assignment. We'll keep the letter in your file, and when you return, just call us to reactivate your account.

question.text: Why does the woman want to cancel her membership?
choices: (A) She will be away for an extended period.
(B) Membership fees are going to be raised.
(D) Her company has changed its hours of operation.

answer.text: (A) She will be away for an extended period.

question.text: What does the man suggest?

W: Hello, are you Maurice Pochon? I’m Marie Roland. Housekeeping sent me to help you set up the dining room. Q1 This isn’t my usual job at the hotel, so I’m afraid you’re going to have to show me what to do.
M: Well, Q2 first we need to clear the dirty dishes and linens from the tables. We just had 50or 60 people in here for breakfast. After we finish that, then we need to put the clean tablecloths on all of the tables. Q3 Then I’ll show you how to do the place settings.
W: OK, sounds simple enough. Why don’t you just show me where to put the dirty dishes and tablecloths, and then we can get to work.

W-Br: Hi, this is Margaret Morelli. I'm scheduled to meet with Mr. Peterson at 8:30 this morning. Q1 I was told a car would pick me up at my hotel and bring me to your office, but it's already 8:15 and no one has arrived.
M-Au: Hello, Ms. Morelli. We are expecting you this morning, but not until nine. I asked the car service to pick you up at 8:30.
W-Br: Oh, Q2 I apologize. I must have read my schedule incorrectly.
M-Au: No problem and Q3 don't forget to bring some form of identification with a photo. The security desk at the front of the building will ask for it when you arrive.

M: If it will help, we can reschedule tomorrow’s staff meeting to two o’clock – but we’d have to meet in the small conference room.
W: Q1 I still won’t be able to attend, so don’t change your plans for me. I’ll be at the board of trustees meeting all day, presenting our division report.
M: If we postpone the staff meeting until next week, Q2 would you be able to report on the board meeting? I’m sure that would be interesting for the staff.
W: Of course. I’d be very happy to. Q3 I’ll try to prepare a summary by then.

question.text: Why is the woman unable to attend the staff meeting tomorrow afternoon?

(B)She will be at a conference center.
(C)She will be at a client meeting.

answer.text: (A)She will be meeting with the board of trustees.

question.text: What will the woman do at the next staff meeting?

answer.text: (A) Talk about the meeting of the trustees

M-Cn: Lucy, Q1 have you come up with any ideas for the print campaign for The Sawgrass Company's new line of spring clothing?
W-Br: Well, Q2 from the samples the client sent us, I think what really stands out is the fabric. The material is so lightweight. Plus, it's washable and wrinkle-resistant.
M-Cn: Then why don't we market it as travel clothing? When we do the photoshoot we can really showcase how the fabric would make the clothing perfect to pack and wear on your next trip.
W-Br: Good idea - we can come up with a travel-related scenario for each ad. Q3 I couldn't book the space for the photo session until the end of the month, so we still have time to figure out all the details.

W: Q1 When is the assignment due?

W: That should be just fine. I’ll get started right away.
